title: Struct update syntax with same struct from different modules breaks compiler

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Hi, I accidently used the struct update syntax with two identical structs from different modules. This resulted in a compiler error. I created a small code example, that repoduces the bug: ### Code ```Rust mod vs { pub struct Bar { pub value: f32, pub other_value: f32, } } struct Bar { value: f32, other_value: f32, } struct Foo { data: Bar, } impl Foo { fn set_value(&mut self, value: f32) { self.data = vs::Bar { value, ..self.data } } } fn main() { let f = Foo { data: Bar { value: 0., other_value: 0., }, }; f.set_value(2); } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) binary: rustc commit-hash: db9d1b20bba1968c1ec1fc49616d4742c1725b4b commit-date: 2022-01-20 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.58.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` Compiling rust_compiler_bug v0.1.0 (/home/simon/Projects/rust_compiler_bug) error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_typeck/src/check/fn_ctxt/_impl.rs:319:25: while adjusting Expr { hir_id: HirId { owner: DefId(0:11 ~ rust_compiler_bug[815d]::{impl#0}::set_value), local_id: 9 }, kind: Path(Resolved(None, Path { span: src/main.rs:16:40: 16:44 (#0), res: Local(HirId { owner: DefId(0:11 ~ rust_compiler_bug[815d]::{impl#0}::set_value), local_id: 2 }), segments: [PathSegment { ident: self#0, hir_id: Some(HirId { owner: DefId(0:11 ~ rust_compiler_bug[815d]::{impl#0}::set_value), local_id: 8 }), res: Some(Local(HirId { owner: DefId(0:11 ~ rust_compiler_bug[815d]::{impl#0}::set_value), local_id: 2 })), args: None, infer_args: true }] })), span: src/main.rs:16:40: 16:44 (#0) }, can't compose [Deref(None) -> Foo] and [Deref(None) -> Foo] thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1169:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.58.1 (db9d1b20b 2022-01-20) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type bin note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `::set_value` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies end of query stack error: could not compile `rust_compiler_bug` ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1169:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic:: 1: std::panic::panic_any:: 2: ::bug 3: ::bug 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::::{closure#0}, ()> 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt:: 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::bug_fmt 7: ::apply_adjustments 8: ::check_field 9: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 10: ::check_expr_kind 11: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 12: ::check_expr_kind 13: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 14: ::check_block_with_expected 15: ::check_expr_with_expectation_and_args 16: ::check_return_expr 17: rustc_typeck::check::check::check_fn 18: ::enter::<&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults, ::enter::{closure#1}, &rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults>::{closure#0}> 19: rustc_typeck::check::typeck 20: >::with_task:: 21: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(&rustc_middle::ty::context::TypeckResults, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job::{closure#3}> 22: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 23: ::typeck 24: ::par_body_owners:: 25: rustc_typeck::check::typeck_item_bodies 26: >::with_task:: 27: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::> 28: ::typeck_item_bodies 29: ::time::<(), rustc_typeck::check_crate::{closure#7}> 30: rustc_typeck::check_crate 31: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 32: >::with_task::> 33: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack::<(core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>, rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepNodeIndex), rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::execute_job>::{closure#3}> 34: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::try_execute_query::>> 35: ::analysis 36: ::enter::> 37: ::enter::, rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> 38: rustc_span::with_source_map::, rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#1}> 39: >::set::, rustc_driver::run_compiler::{closure#1}>::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>>::{closure#0}::{closure#0}, core::result::Result<(), rustc_errors::ErrorReported>> ```
